data.name: BIMonitoringServiceNotFound
data.value: Cannot connect to the PerformancePoint Service Application in the local farm

data.name: CreateApplication_Confirm_Message
data.value: The PerformancePoint Service application was successfully created.
data.comment: Placeholders: 0=Service Application name, Example="BI Service Application"

data.name: CreateApplication_FailCreate_Message
data.value: PerformancePoint Service Application could not be created. Additional details have been logged for the administrator

data.name: CreateApplication_FailEdit_Message
data.value: PerformancePoint Service Application could not be modified. Additional details have been logged for the administrator

data.name: CreateApplication_Data_Top_Prompt
data.value: Specify settings for this service application. You can change these settings later from the Manage Service Applications page.

data.name: CreateApplication_Data_Default_Description
data.value: Add this service application's proxy to the farm's default proxy list.

data.name: CreateApplication_Data_Name_Taken_Error
data.value: This name is already being used by another PerformancePoint Service Application in this farm. Specify another name.

data.name: CreateApplication_Data_Bottom_Prompt
data.value: Click Next to continue creating a new PerformancePoint Service Application.

data.name: DeleteCommentsByDate_Confirmation_Message
data.value: The delete request was sent. It may take up to a few hours to process the request.

data.name: DeleteCommentsByDate_Inforation_lable
data.value: To delete old comments from all dashboards, specify a date then click Delete.

data.name: DeleteCommentsByDate_Note_Description
data.value: This action is not reversible and may take up to a few hours to process.

data.name: EditPpsBiServiceSettings_Cache_Description
data.value: Temporarily storing frequently-accessed items, or caching, decreases load times for future requests. Enter the duration for items to remain in the cache.

data.name: EditPpsBiServiceSettings_Comments_Description
data.value: Users who have appropriate permissions can annotate scorecard cells (in Dashboard Designer and on a deployed SharePoint site). Multiple comments can be made per annotation.

data.name: EditPpsBiServiceSettings_Comments_MaxAnnotationAllowed
data.value: Maximum number of annotated cells per scorecard:

data.name: EditPpsBiServiceSettings_DataSources_Description
data.value: Set the duration of no response before a data source query is cancelled.

data.name: EditPpsBiServiceSettings_Filternts_Description
data.value: Enter how long to remember user-selected filter values and how often to clear them when they expire. Set the maximum number of members to retrieve into a filter of type "tree".

data.name: EditPpsBiServiceSettings_Filters_TreeViewControlMaxNumRecordsToRender
data.value: Maximum members to load in filter tree:

data.name: EditPpsBiServiceSettings_IntegerOutOfRangeError
data.value: The value entered is not valid. Please enter a whole number from {0}-{1} without any delimeters.

data.name: EditPpsBiServiceSettings_ShowDetails_Description
data.value: Set the limits for the number of rows returned when a user clicks "Show Details".

data.name: EditPpsBiServiceSettings_ValueRequiredError
data.value: This setting cannot be blank. Please enter a whole number from {0}-{1}.

data.name: EditServiceSettingsPageHelpText
data.value: Edit settings for the service application

data.name: FarmNotFoundNew
data.value: Unable to retrieve the sharepoint farm

data.name: GlobalSettingsPageDescription
data.value: Configure settings such as cache durations, filter behavior, and query time-out.

data.name: InvalidServiceApplicationIdSpecified
data.value: The service application ID is not valid.

data.name: InvalidServiceProxyTypeName
data.value: The service proxy type name is not valid.

data.value: The service type name is not valid.

data.name: PageBusy
data.value: The page is busy submitting data to the server.

data.value: Enter the web address (URL) for a trusted location for content.

data.name: TrustedContents_Edit_Input_LocationDescription_Description
data.value: The optional description of the purpose of this trusted location.

data.name: TrustedContents_Message_ContentExist
data.value: This URL is already a trusted content location.

data.name: TrustedContents_Message_EnterValidAddress
data.value: Enter a valid address for a Site Collection, Site, or List.

data.name: TrustedContents_Message_ListNotContent
data.value: Document libraries are not valid for content. Enter a valid URL for a site collection, site, or list.

data.name: TrustedDataSources_PageDescription
data.value: Define SharePoint locations to store data sources.

data.value: Specify the URL and location type for this trusted location.

data.value: Specify the URL and location type for this trusted location.

data.name: TrustedContents_Edit_Input_Type_Description
data.value: Depending on the URL you entered, you may need to specify the location type.

data.value: Depending on the URL you entered, you may need to specify the location type.

data.name: CreateApplication_Data_Name_Description
data.value: Specify a name and default status for this service application.

data.name: CreateApplication_Data_Name_Proxy_Description
data.value: The setting makes this service application available by default for web applications in this farm to use. Do not check this setting if you wish to specify manually which web applications should use this service application.

data.name: CreateApplication_Data_USA
data.value: Secure Store and Unattended Service Account:

data.name: CreateApplication_Data_USA_Description
data.value: The Secure Store Service is used to store the Unattended Service Account used for authenticating to data sources.

data.name: CreateApplication_Data_USA_Description_Part1
data.value: The Unattended Service Account is set after configuring the PerformancePoint Service application. The setting is located in "Manage service applications" in SharePoint Central Administration under the PerformancePoint Services management page. A running Secure Store Service Application and Proxy are required.

data.name: CreateApplication_Data_USA_Description_Part2
data.value: The Unattended Service Account must be set for PerformancePoint Services to connect to data sources except as the currently authenticated user.

data.name: CreateApplication_Additional_Message
data.comment: Text on the application creation confirmaton page.

data.name: CreateApplication_Confirm_List_1
data.value: The PerformancePoint Service Application, {0}, and the associated service proxy were successfully created. The settings for this service can be modified through manage service applications in SharePoint Central Administration.
data.comment: Placeholders: 0=Service Application name, Example="BI Service Application"

data.name: CreateApplication_Confirm_List_2
data.value: The service will use application pool, {0}, to run instances of the service application, {1}.
data.comment: Placeholders: 0=Application pool name, Example="MyAppPool"; 1=Service Application name, Example="BI Service Application"

data.name: CreateApplication_Confirm_List_3
data.comment: Placeholders: 0=Application pool name, Example="MyAppPool"; 1=Domain account, Example="DomainA\UserB"; 2=Service Application name, Example="BI Service Application"

data.name: CreateApplication_Confirm_List_4
data.value: In order for the service to access data sources, an Unattended Service Account must be defined for {0}, using SharePoint Central Administration.
data.comment: Placeholders: 0=Service Application name, Example="PerformancePoint Service Application"

data.name: CreateApplication_Confirm_List_5
data.value: The PerformancePoint web application and site collection features must be enabled in order to use the PerformancePoint capabilities.

data.name: CreateApplication_Confirm_List_6
data.value: Trusted locations should be configured through manage service applications to prevent use of any site collection or sites, with PPS features enabled, that could allow for unauthorized access to data sources.

data.name: CreateApplication_Confirm_Summary
data.value: The following is a summary of what happened during the provisioning process.

data.name: CreateApplication_Edit_Confirm_List_1
data.value: The PerformancePoint Service application was successfully renamed to {0}.
data.comment: Placeholders: 0=Service Application name, Example="BI Service Application"

data.name: CreateApplication_Edit_Confirm_List_DefaultProxyGroup
data.value: The proxy was set as the default for the current proxy group.
data.comment: Placeholders: 0=Service Application name, Example="BI Service Application"

data.name: CreateApplication_Edit_Confirm_List_2
data.value: The service will use the {0} application pool to run instances of the {1} service application.
data.comment: Placeholders: 0=Application pool name; 1=Service Application name, Example="BI Service Application"

data.name: CreateApplication_Edit_Confirm_List_3
data.value: {0} is running as the {1} domain account.
data.comment: Placeholders: 0=Application pool name, Example="MyAppPool"; 1=Domain account, Example="DomainA\UserB"

data.name: CreateApplication_Edit_Confirm_Summary
data.value: The PerformancePoint Service Application was succesfully updated:

data.name: CreateApplication_Error_AppPool_NameInUse
data.value: The application pool could not be created because the name is already in use. Select "Use existing application pool" or provide another name for the application pool.

data.name: CreateApplication_Error_AppPool_Unknown
data.value: An error has ocurred while getting or creating the application pool. Try selecting a different application pool or use a different application pool name.

data.name: EditPpsBiServiceSettings_UnattendedServiceAccount
data.value: Secure Store and Unattended Service Account

data.name: EditPpsBiServiceSettings_UnattendedServiceAccount_Description
data.value: Configure the Secure Store Service which is used to store the Unattended Service Account used for authenticating with data sources.

data.name: EditPpsBiServiceSettings_NoSecureStoreProxyWarningMessage
data.value:
No valid Secure Store Service Applications were found associated with the proxy group.
Configuring the Unattended Service Account requires that a running Secure Store Service instance exists. The Secure Store Service must exist in the associated proxy group. The Secure Store Service can be configured in SharePoint Central Administration.

data.name: EditPpsBiServiceSettings_EncryptionKeyToolTip
data.value: The default secure store service in this proxy group will be used to store the Unattended Service Account.

data.name: EditPpsBiServiceSettings_InvalidAccount
data.value: The account credentials for the Unattended Service Account are not valid. Verify the domain user name and password are correct and that the account is located in a Trusted Domain.

data.name: EditPpsBiServiceSettings_DecompositionTree_Description
data.value: Set the maximum number of individual items (per level) returned to the decomposition tree visualization. The minimum value is 0. The maximum is 1,000,000.
